Ask HN: Why no crypto token tied to content sharing in true P2P fashion?
text:
Why are we still stuck with torrents as the best thing to share P2P content with?

Why hasn't there been a crypto that rewards you for sharing content on a network?

Imagine: You buy 30TB of hard drive, you have a 1 gigabit connection. What not give that storage to the swarm and you P2P to whatever is needed by the swarm and earn a crypto in exchange?

Is anyone building this? Why not? Is it an impossible problem to solve?

Show HN: Talk to ChatGPT to help you improve your foreign language skill
text:
Leah is a Google Chrome extension that combines voice recognition, voice synthesis and ChatGPT to provide an environment where you can improve your foreign language skills.

Features: * Prompt injection: Choose a prompt and whenever you start a conversation, Leah will inject the prompt. * Prefix injection: To reinforce certain prompt, you can inject a prefix such as "translate:" to every question. * Choose different languages to speak and listen to ChatGPT.

Prompt Examples: * I want you to be a translator from English to Spanish as spoken in Spain. You should only translate, do not answer or comment on any of the content. My first sentence is “Hello, how are you?” * I want you to pretend to be a French native speaker who lives in Paris. Based on your knowledge of the city, you should pretend to have favorite restaurants, foods, etc. I will speak in English and you will reply in French until I ask you to stop. Keep your responses brief and the language simple, at the A2 CEFR level. To start, tell me a random fact about Paris.

* Youtube demo: https://github.com/drorm/leah * Install from the Chrome store: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/leah-language-educator-an/bolaopgaickihobdlddefmdffopigkmh * How to use: https://drorm.github.io/leah/ * Github repo: https://github.com/drorm/leah
